programme.title: America: Facts vs. Fiction

programme.title: America: Facts vs. Fiction

programme.title: America: Facts vs. Fiction

programme.desc: A look at how Hitler implemented changes through anti-Semitic clothing laws, the establishing of SS bride schools and breeding programmes that saw children stolen from their parents.

programme.title: Hitler's Empire: The Post-War Plan
programme.desc: In this episode we'll examine how the Nazis began to stamp their image on Germany and the nations that had fallen under the German jackboot. From plans to redesign Berlin as the capital of the world, to the destruction of Warsaw.

programme.title: Hitler's Empire: The Post-War Plan
programme.desc: In this episode we'll uncover support for the National Socialist movement within America, revealing outposts of Nazi Germany within the land of the free. We'll also learn about the man thought he believed he was the American Fuhrer.

programme.title: Hitler's Empire: The Post-War Plan
programme.desc: In this episode, Guy looks at the Nazi plans for Britain. From pre-war spying, concentration camps on British soil, to national landmarks earmarked by Hitler for his own use.

programme.title: High Hitler and His Nazi Supersoldiers

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Officer Canfield handles a group of ATV riders reported for riding prohibited trails. Officer Holmes investigates a suspected illegal deer kill, and an abandoned car is found on the Androscoggin River that might be linked to a crime.(n)

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Officer MacFadzen tracks a trapper suspected of poaching, and stealing a trail camera surveying the illegal traps. Officer Lucas investigates the death of an owl. And, officers question a father and son who may have hunted over illegal bait.(n)

programme.title: Eden: Untamed Planet
programme.desc: In Southeast Alaska, there's an ice-bound Eden that harbors possibly the richest temperate rainforests of all.

programme.title: Planet Earth: Blue Planet II
programme.desc: At the coast, two worlds collide. Coasts is the story of how our wildlife survives in this ever-changing world. It's a roller-coaster ride of heart-stopping action and epic drama, with characters from beautiful to bizarre.

programme.title: Planet Earth: Blue Planet II
programme.desc: In our green seas, competition is fierce. Sunlight powers vast kelp forests, mangroves, prairies of seagrass and blooms of algae. Here, animals must fight for space and food. In kelp forests, a common octopus must become the ultimate escape artist.

programme.title: Planet Earth: Blue Planet II
programme.desc: Corals build themselves homes of limestone in the warm, clear, shallow seas of the tropics. Their reefs occupy less than one tenth of one per cent of the ocean floor, yet they are home to a quarter of all known marine species.

programme.title: Planet Earth: Blue Planet II
programme.desc: The big blue is the world's greatest wilderness. It is a marine desert far from shore and many kilometers deep with nothing to eat and nowhere to hide.

programme.title: Meerkat Manor: Rise of the Dynasty
programme.desc: Alone and at risk, evicted Sencha is clinging close to her family in the hope of a reprieve until an unexpected lifeline presents itself in the shape of rover Lilac; who brings with him the prospect of a better life.

programme.title: Planet Earth: Blue Planet II
programme.sub-title: The Making of Blue Planet II
programme.desc: The stories behind Planet Earth: Blue Planet II's most memorable moments. Discover what went into creating this stunning series, as the crews reveal the lengths they went to and the ground-breaking filming technology.

programme.title: Eden: Untamed Planet
programme.desc: Borneo is the richest rainforest island of all, home to 40,000 species of plants and animals. 6,000 of them are unique, and more are discovered almost daily.

programme.title: Night at the Museum: Secret of the Tomb
programme.desc: A museum security guard travels to London to figure out how to save the fading magic that brings the historical figures of the museum to life.

A geologist discovers that solar storms are heating the Earth's core. International governments keep the impending disaster a secret. However, a writer stumbles upon the same information and races to save his family and gain access to the 'arks.'.

programme.desc: Army medical researchers must contain a deadly virulent disease and locate its source.
